iati-activity.title: Total WASH in Salaga Senior High School, N Ghana
iati-activity.description: Total WASH (water, sanitation and hygiene) is a new concept for WaterAid Ghana (WAG). While it places the school at the centre of the project and addresses basic water, sanitation, and hygiene needs, it also goes further to address other critical areas including food and nutrition. Salaga Senior High School has been selected as the school for this intervention. The Senior High School is about 2 km outside the community and is located opposite the East Gonja District Assembly. According to the school authorities, the school has a population of approximately 1,570 students, the population may rise up to 2,125 in the next academic year. Salaga Senior High school is located in East Gonja district in the South Eastern section of the Northern Region of Ghana. It shares boundaries with Yendi municipal and Tamale metropolitan to the North, Central Gonja district to the West, Kpandai districts to the East and the Volta and Brong Ahafo regions to the South. Due to the difficult nature of the intervention area and the highlighted needs of the school children, the project will focus on addressing the water and sanitation and waste removal issues. The intervention will ensure the children now and in the future have continued safe access to water, sanitation, hygiene and improved nutrition. WAG proposes the following outputs can be provided based on funding of 50,000GBP:- Construct 2 rain water harvesting tanks (30meter cubic each)- Construct 3 8-seater separate toilets for boys and girls, to ensure privacy and address issues such as menstrual hygiene management and boy/girl inclusive institutional latrines - Construction of a 30m3 biogas facility to support the safe disposal of waste from the latrines and flow of energy (gas) to the school kitchen. Provide agro-ecological and biodegradable (non-petroleum based) fertilizer. - Minimise the cost to the school for the management of faecal matter. - Transform faecal matter into a school resource. The soft component of the project includes engaging in the following activities (partial list):- Training, Capacity Building Workshops for biogas artisans- M&E support to include baseline data collection and project oversight visits- Facilitate 1 Learning Forum for school and community on project- Form and Train School Health Clubs- School Hygiene Promotion activities- Community Hygiene Promotion activities - Form and train Community Hygiene Volunteers
